TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebPartDescriptionCollection extends System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Consists of a collection of objects to be used with catalogs of controls. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WebPartDescriptionCollection class is created by the various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls in their implementations of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart.GetAvailableWebPartDescriptions%2A> method. For each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control that is contained in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> control, a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object is created. This object maintains basic information about a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control, including its ID, its title, its description, and a path to an associated icon. The various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls can use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object to display a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control's information in the catalog, without having to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPart> control itself.
The WebPartDescriptionCollection class is used internally by the Web Parts control set to maintain a collection of all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects used in a catalog. The WebPartDescriptionCollection collection is used only when a page is in catalog display mode. When a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> control is being rendered, it loops through the WebPartDescriptionCollection collection, adding the information from each <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> object to the displayed catalog.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes an empty new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This overload of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor can be used to create an empty collection. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ImportCatalogPart> control creates an empty <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> object if the content of an imported description file is `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.ICollection webPartDescriptions) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection of objects that correspond to the controls in a catalog.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a object by passing in an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> collection of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WebPartDescriptionCollection constructor is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart.GetAvailableWebPartDescriptions%2A> method implementations within the various <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogPart> controls to create a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CopyTo method is useful when you want to assemble a custom array that can contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescription> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartDescriptionCollection> collection.
